p:
We applied a post-stratification adjustment to each of these weights to arrive at the final statistical weight for each subject. This adjustment helped us to weight the age-sex groups within each municipality to match the distribution in the French Guiana total population. Ten age groups ([2–5 years] [5–10], [10–15], [15–20], [20–25], [25–35], [35–45], [45–55], [55–65], and ≥65 years) were defined within male and female groups, and for each age-sex subgroup, we applied an adjustment factor c
ijk to obtain a final statistical weight w
ijk = (M
i
/m
i
)*c
ijk , where i, j, k are the indices of municipalities, sex groups, and age groups, respectively.
